description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink, with use of red, blue and green ink. The text is framed within a single red line (gold, black and red on fol. 1b-2a). Some titles are crudely illuminated in gold, red, blue and green. The titles of some texts are now wanting (see 111a; fol. 116b, where a portion of the title is still extant). European paper with watermark. Fol. 128 consists of a leaf pasted on the recto of a later leaf ; verso blank. The upper part of most leaves show signs of dampness. Several inscriptions on the pastedown of the upper and lower covers, including a reading statement in the name of ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq ibn al-A--? (upper cover).
abstract: Collection of twenty-five texts of the Druze community, comprising texts 15-39 in Sylvestre de Sacy's description of Druze writings in Exposé de la religion des Druzes (1838).
contents: 1. fol. 1b-14b: al-Risālah al-dāmighah lil-fāsiq al-radd ʻalá al-Nuṣayrī laʻanahu al-Mawlá fī kull kawr wa-dawr.
3. fol. 25a-37a: Risālat al-Tanzīh ilá jamāʻat al-Muwaḥḥidīn.
9. fol. 60a-b: Mukātabah ilá ahl al-Kudīyah al-bayḍāʼ.
12. fol. 63b-65a: al-Risālah allatī ursilat ilá walī al-ʻahd ʻahd al-muslimīn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Ilyās.
13. fol. 65a-66b: Risālat Khumār Ibn Jaysh al-Sulaymānī al-ʻAkāwī.
17. fol. 77b-79a: al-Taqdīs duʻāʼ al-sādiqīn duʻāʼ najāt al-Muwaḥḥidīn al-ʻārifīn.
18. fol. 79a-80a: Dhikr maʻrifat al-Imām wa-asmāʼ al-Ḥudūd al-ʻilwīyah rūḥānī wa-jusmānī.
20. fol. 84a-88a: al-Risālah al-mawsūmah bi-al-Iʻdhār wa-al-indhār al-shāfīyah li-qulūb ahl al-ḥaqq min al-marḍ wa-al-iḥtiyār.
22. fol. 97a-110b: Kitāb fīhi taqsīm al-ʻulūm wa-ithbāt al-ḥaqq wa-kashf al-ma[knūn].
23. fol. 111a-116b: [Risālat al-zinād] wa-al-sabīl al-wāḍiḥ lil-ṭālib al-murtād.
24. fol. 116b-122a: Risālat al-Shamʻah wa-mathaluhā fī al-tawḥīd wa-mathalu ḥudūdihā ʻalá al-maslak al-thālith.
extent: 128 leaves: paper ; 212 x 157 (152 x 104) mm. bound to 210 x 165 mm.
subject: Druzes—Sacred books
binding_note: Brown leather over paper pasteboard for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Both covers have a central blind stamped mandorla and an outer border consisting of fillets. Paper pastedowns.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
